comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Ross Erastus Rowell (22 September 1884 - 6 September 1947) was a highly decorated United States Marine Corps aviator who achieved the rank of lieutenant general by the end of his 40 years of service. He served as Director of Marine Corps Aviation from May 30, 1935 until March 10, 1939 and was one of the three senior officers of Marine Corps aviation during World War II. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ross_E._Rowell
